value:
My grandson inherited much from his
parents. A shame he also inherited
his grandfather's idiocy.

Dragons have always been the mortal
enemy of humanity. Even if they
appear human, they are anything but.

There's no shortage of pretty young
ladies around here. It takes me back
to the days of my youth...

I was once quite the beauty, you
know. Strapping young men would
spend fortunes just to win my heart...$k$pAnd then I'd dump them. Ha!

What right do people who can't even
make their own family happy have to
crow on and on about world peace?

I'm visiting on behalf of your friend
$Nf.$k$pDon't bother putting together a fancy
welcome—a warm cup of tea will do.
...Well? Get to it!

My world has already survived one
calamity. Everything I've studied was
to make sure we never see a second.

Hah! Too bad for you, there's still
some fight left in these old bones.

The darkness is not to be feared.
When it calls, answer. Where it
leads, follow. Deeper, ever deeper...

I look experienced enough to make
use of this? Hmph. That had better
be a compliment.

I am Niime. Apparently, my research
into elder magic has led some to call
me the Mountain Hermit. Hmph.

The spells I command are often
derided as forbidden, dark magic due
to their destructive potential.$k$pMy son Canas had a natural aptitude
for it, but my grandson did not inherit
the necessary fortitude of mind.$k$pI had hoped he might be able to carry
on my work, and my disappointment
led me to being...harsh with him.$k$pElder magic is mighty, but it takes in
equal measure from the one using it...
A price too costly for my progeny.$k$pIn the end, my work will die with me.
There are a few loose ends to tie up,
but I trust you are up to the task.
そーらっ
ほいっ
うっ…
How cruel...
Nothing I can't handle.
Heh, not bad.
Fool!
You wish to die? Good.
I've had...my fun...
Hohoho...
I am Niime, though perhaps you'd know me better as the Mountain Hermit.
Oh, were you trying to startle me? When you've seen as much as I have, little things like that stop surprising you.

Dark magic is not something to take lightly.
Used carelessly, its power could destroy the very world around us.
That girl, Sophia... She reminds me of myself, back when I was young.
There is still so much I'd like to learn about dragons...
Perhaps our paths will cross again, in another time or world... Who can say?
It seems I've grown rather fond of you. You should make use of my dark magic!
Understood
Well, well…
No rest for the weary!
